intro: Centaurea luschaniana, commonly known as the Luschan's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features striking blue to violet flowers with yellow centers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often branched and somewhat woody. Centaurea luschaniana is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands.
